title: How to prove that a = 0 if and only if -a = 0 - Quora

response.answer_text: A2A. How do I prove that a = 0 if and only if -a = 0? By definition, -x is the additive inverse of x where x+(-x) = 0 and -(-x)=xBy definition, 0 is the additive identify where 0+x = x If x=a and a=0, then 0 = a+(-a) = 0+(-a) = -a If x=-a and -a=0, then 0=-a+(-(-a))=-a+(a)= 0+(a) = a

If -a=0 then multiply by -1 to get a=0. If-a≠0* then multiplying -a by -1 will result in a real number greater than zero. *assume a is positive. If a is a real number less than zero then -a≠0 and multiplying by -1 results in a positive real number less than 0.
